content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #85019 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?

unsure to prioritize this, it's the now well-known issue with incremental building. The general issue is critical but taken care of and there's a mitigation path.
This issue per se is probably critical but it's now linked to the main tracking issue so I would remove the I-prioritize label (makes sense?)
So given that incremental is disabled by default on stable, is there any plans to backport these fixes?
According to the blog post my understanding is that some bugfixes may be backported to a 1.52.2, others will be available in the 1.53 beta.
I don't have yet clear which will be marked for backporting. PR #83901 you mention doesnt yet seem to be a candidate for a 1.52.2. I guess on Thursday backports in general will be discussed
#84970 already tracks the different issues and fixes, so yeah I guess this doesn't need priroitization

(self note) the topic of the backports is being discussed
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/131828-t-compiler/topic/unstable.20fingerprints.20-.20actually.20in.201.2E52/near/238357575
